mapper.sql: a.id AS "id", a.company_name AS "companyName", a.company_addr AS "companyAddr", a.create_by AS "createBy.id", u1.login_name AS "createBy.loginName", a.create_date AS "createDate", a.update_by AS "updateBy.id", u2.login_name AS "updateBy.loginName", a.update_date AS "updateDate", a.remarks AS "remarks", a.del_flag AS "delFlag"
LEFT JOIN sys_user u1 ON u1.id = a.create_by LEFT JOIN sys_user u2 ON u2.id = a.update_by
mapper.select:
SELECT
FROM t_management_company a
a.del_flag = #{DEL_FLAG_NORMAL}
AND a.company_name LIKE '%'||#{companyName}||'%' '%'+#{companyName}+'%' concat('%',#{companyName},'%')
AND a.company_addr LIKE '%'||#{companyAddr}||'%' '%'+#{companyAddr}+'%' concat('%',#{companyAddr},'%')

mapper.insert: INSERT INTO t_management_company( id, company_name, company_addr, create_by, create_date, update_by, update_date, remarks, del_flag ) VALUES ( #{id}, #{companyName}, #{companyAddr}, #{createBy.id}, #{createDate}, #{updateBy.id}, #{updateDate}, #{remarks}, #{delFlag} )
mapper.update: UPDATE t_management_company SET company_name = #{companyName}, company_addr = #{companyAddr}, update_by = #{updateBy.id}, update_date = #{updateDate}, remarks = #{remarks} WHERE id = #{id}
mapper.select: SELECT a.id AS "id", a.company_name AS "companyName", a.company_addr AS "companyAddr", a.create_date AS "createDate", a.update_date AS "updateDate", a.remarks AS "remarks", a.del_flag AS "delFlag" FROM t_management_company a a.del_flag = #{DEL_FLAG_NORMAL} AND a.company_name = #{companyName} AND a.company_addr = #{companyAddr}
